content: frankie s knitted stuff petal pouches these flower pouches are very useful for holding all sorts of bits and pieces they close with drawstrings threaded under the petals and hold a surprising amount each pouch is knitted flat in four garter stitch pieces which are then sewn together to make the finished pouch i have used yarn or ribbon for the drawstrings and added a few beads to the ends yarn and needles i used stylecraft special dk 295 m / 100g for all three of my pouches and 3 mm / us size 2½ needles i worked to a gauge of about 13 stitches and 26 row to 5 cm / 2 ² the gauge is not hugely important but you do want it fairly firm for this pattern you will need two contrasting colours of yarn one for the petals and one for the rest the colours i used were cloud blue and aster for the small pouch spice and saffron for the medium and plum and magenta for the biggest size you don t need a lot of yarn to knit these pouches even the biggest size only uses 60g all together about 30g of each colour the smallest size only takes 20g in all and the middle one 40g 1 measurements they are tricky to measure but if you open them out flat you can see that they have square bases these squares are roughly 10 12 5 and 15 cm across that s 4 5 and 6 the smallest size fits in my hand when closed and the others … don t the knitting each pouch is made up of four identical shapes half in each of the two colours with a row of eyelets in the middle for the drawstrings i shall give the instructions for the smallest size with variations for the other two pouches in brackets using the petal colour cast on one stitch increasing row 1 kf&b 2 sts row 2 kf&b k1 3 sts row 3 knit row 4 kf&b twice k1 5 sts row 5 knit now the increase pattern settles down to a two row repeat row 1 kf&b k to last 2 sts kf&b k1 row 2 knit repeat these two row until you have 21 31 41 stitches ending with a plain knit row row 2 2 adding the eyelets row 1 knit row 2 purl row 3 k1 *yf k2tog repeat from * to end row 4 purl row 5 knit change to your main colour with a row of rib p1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end that last row helps to blur the colour change you will now have a line of 10 15 20 eyelets now for a bit of straight knitting … knit 10 16 20 row decreasing every row k to the last 2 sts k2tog repeat this row until you are down to three stitches and then cast off with the double decrease cast off sl 1 kwise
